intro: Cyphocalyx, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is characterized by its unique inflorescence, which consists of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. The plant typically has thick, fleshy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Cyphocalyx species are native to various regions in the Americas and are often found in moist, shaded environments. They are notable for their ornamental value and have been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
